label: 懐徳堂
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: [An academy in] Osaka, [founded by] a group of benefactors in 1724 as a school of Chinese studies for commoners.  It soon received government recognition and conintued to prosper until the beginning of the Meiji period (p. 725). [大阪]
